Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the idea that only 6% of people actually died from COVID-19, implying that the majority died from other reasons. The expert's verdict clarifies that COVID-19 was responsible for nearly all of the deaths involving the virus.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it fails to provide any evidence or data to back up the statement that only 6% of people died from COVID-19. The expert's verdict provides data from the CDC and other sources to refute this claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that if a person had other conditions or comorbidities along with COVID-19, then COVID-19 was not the primary cause of death. The expert's verdict clarifies that having comorbidities does not mean COVID-19 was a non-factor in the deaths.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim presents an alternative explanation for COVID-19 deaths by suggesting that the majority died from other reasons. The expert's verdict provides evidence that COVID-19 was the primary cause of death for the majority of cases.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that COVID-19 was responsible for a significant number of deaths. The expert's verdict provides data from the CDC and other sources to support this fact.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misconstruing data on coronavirus deaths and presenting a misleading narrative. The expert's verdict highlights the inaccuracies in the claim made by President Trump.
